      • suffix

        public boolean suffix(java.lang.String word)
        Description copied from interface: SuffixTrie
        A suffix of a string is a substring that occurs at the end of the Suffix Trie. The path for the word is traversed and the leaf is checked to see if it contains the terminal character.
        Specified by:
        suffix in interface SuffixTrie
        Parameters:
        word - Given word to compare.
        Returns:
        True if the word is a suffix, false otherwise.

      • count

        public int count(java.lang.String word)
        Description copied from interface: SuffixTrie
        Count how many times word appears in the Suffix Trie. This is done by following the path of the given word starting from the head. The leaves under the node are the number of occurrences.
        Specified by:
        count in interface SuffixTrie
        Parameters:
        word - Given word to count.
        Returns:
        The number of occurrences.

      • countImpl

                      java.lang.String subStringWord)

      • longestRepeat

        public java.lang.String longestRepeat()
        Find the longest repeated substring by finding the deepest node from the root to a node containing multiple children. The depth is measured by characters traversed through the trie from the root to the node. The string spelled by the edges from the root to the deepest node is the longest repeated substring.
        Specified by:
        longestRepeat in interface SuffixTrie
        Returns:
        Longest repeated substring.

      • longestSubstring

        public java.lang.String longestSubstring(java.lang.String givenWord)
        Description copied from interface: SuffixTrie
        Finds the longest common substring between the given word and Suffix Trie. To accomplish this first traverse the given list. If the given list is traversed, return it since it is the longest substring. If a dead end is found, the suffix link on the current traverse string is used. The current string is also added to the list. When using the suffix link, the the tail of the current string is taken as the new current String and the Suffix Trie is traversed from the root. If the current String is empty, there is no suffix link and thus the character from the given word is removed. The above steps are repeated until the given word is empty. The longest string is returned.
        Specified by:
        longestSubstring in interface SuffixTrie
        Parameters:
        givenWord - The word to compare with the edu.um.SuffixTrie.SuffixTrie.
        Returns:
        The longest substring.

      • getSuffixLink

        private OffsetLengthNode getSuffixLink(OffsetLengthNode currentNode,
                                       java.lang.String word)
        Get the suffix Link of Node. This is done by passing the tail of the word you want the suffix link of.
        Parameters:
        currentNode - The current Node.
        word - The tail of the word you want the suffix link of.
        Returns:
        The Node of the suffix link.

      • printWordInABox

      • nextTraverse

        private javafx.util.Pair<OffsetLengthNode,java.lang.String> nextTraverse(OffsetLengthNode currentSuffixNode,
                                                                         java.lang.String inputWord)
        Move from one node to another node given the word to traverse. If it is possible to traverse it will return the new Node and the remaining string. Otherwise it will return null. The return value can be present or missing, therefore no exception will be thrown since that result is excepted (It is not an error).
        Parameters:
        currentSuffixNode - The Node you want to traverse from.
        inputWord - The word inputted that want to traverse.
        Returns:
        null if traversing to another node is not possible otherwise Pair containing the next Node and the remaining String from the input word.

      • determineNewWordAfterTraverse

        private java.lang.String determineNewWordAfterTraverse(java.lang.String traverseString,
                                                       java.lang.String inputWord)
        Returns the new string after traversing. Multiple characters can be traversed at once.
        Parameters:
        traverseString - The traverse String.
        inputWord - The input word.
        Returns:
        The string after removing the traversed characters from the input word.
